The kettle plug is suitable for use in which kind of outlet?
Why does the kettle use a plastic handle instead of metal?

options.C: To prevent heat transfer to the user’s hand

multiple_choice.question: What functional advantage does the black base provide?

options.B: It acts as a stabilizer and heat-insulating layer

multiple_choice.question: Why is the handle located on the side and not the top?

options.C: To provide better balance and pouring control

multiple_choice.question: What explains the use of metal for the main kettle body?

options.C: To provide better heat conduction and durability

multiple_choice.question: Why is the cord designed to exit from the back bottom area?

options.B: To keep the front clean and safe during pouring

multiple_choice.question: How does the cylindrical shape benefit kettle design?

options.A: Maximizes heat retention and water capacity

multiple_choice.question: Why might the silver Philips logo be placed in the center front?
Why is black used for the power base and plug?

options.A: It resists visible dirt and matches common socket colors

multiple_choice.question: Which design feature most helps prevent water spillage?
What safety reason justifies the plug being a 3-pin type?

options.C: It includes a ground connection to prevent shock

multiple_choice.question: Why does the design omit transparent water level indicators?

options.B: To prevent leakage and simplify structure

multiple_choice.question: Why is the plug wire permanently attached instead of removable?

options.B: To ensure safety and prevent misplacement

multiple_choice.question: What visual cue suggests that the kettle has seen regular use?

options.A: Visible scratches on the handle and scuffing on the base

multiple_choice.question: What feature makes the kettle safer during hot water pouring?
Why is the kettle likely used in kitchens and dorms?

options.B: It boils water quickly and efficiently

multiple_choice.question: What visual evidence suggests this kettle is in working condition?
Which of the following parts is most susceptible to wear?
What part helps prevent electric shock?
What makes the design suitable for mass production?

options.B: Simple geometric form and standardized materials
